DataElement.preferredName: Person Karnofsky Performance Status Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient meets the eligibility criteria for Karnofsky performance status score.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Karnofsky Performance Status Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to person's measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities (Karnofsky which has scores range from 0 to 100) as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Karnofsky Performance Status Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Karnofsky Performance Status. A standard way of measuring the ability of cancer patients to perform ordinary tasks.  The scores range from 0 to 100, with a higher score indicating a better ability to carry out daily activities.  KPS may be used to determine a patient's prognosis, to measure changes in functioning, or to decide if a patient could be included in a clinical trial.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: An index designed for classifying patients 16 years of age or older by their functional impairment.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is Karnofsky performance stat
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is Karnofsky performance status greater than or equal to 70%?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is Karnofsky performance status greater than or equal to 60%?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is Karnofsky performance status greater than or equal to 50% within 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is Karnofsky performance status greater than or equal to 60% (ECOG 0, 1 or 2)?
